meanings.definition: A decrease or decline in quantity or quality.
meanings.sent1: The falloffs in sales have impacted the company's profits.
meanings.sent2: The falloffs in the number of students attending the school are concerning.
meanings.sent3: The falloffs in candy supply left the trick-or-treaters disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The falloffs in motivation can make it hard to stay focused.
meanings.sent5: The falloffs in temperature signaled the arrival of winter.

meanings.definition: The act of falling off or dropping.
meanings.sent1: The falloffs of leaves from the tree created a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The falloffs of rocks from the cliff were dangerous for hikers below.
meanings.sent3: The falloffs of confetti at the party added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The falloffs of raindrops from the roof made a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The falloffs of snow from the roof made a soft landing below.

meanings.definition: A decrease in intensity or strength.
meanings.sent1: The falloffs in the music volume signaled the end of the concert.
meanings.sent2: The falloffs in the athlete's performance were noticeable during the game.
meanings.sent3: The falloffs in the superhero's powers made for an interesting plot twist.
meanings.sent4: The falloffs in the wind speed calmed the stormy weather.
meanings.sent5: The falloffs in the sunlight created a peaceful atmosphere in the room.
